text: I had finished: Miss Temple regarded me a few minutes in order to arrange coherently what I had to do, and trust he will excuse my not having done it before. #JaneEyre

passages.fragment: I had finished : Miss Temple regarded me a few minutes in
passages.full_quote: <used>I had finished: Miss Temple regarded me a few minutes in</used> silence; she then said -- "I know something of Mr. Lloyd; I shall write to him; if his reply agrees with your statement, you shall be publicly cleared from every imputation; to me, Jane, you are clear now."

passages.fragment: a few minutes in order to arrange coherently what I had to
passages.full_quote: I resolved, in the depth of my heart, that I would be most moderate -- most correct; and, having reflected <used>a few minutes in order to arrange coherently what I had to</used> say, I told her all the story of my sad childhood

passages.fragment: what I had to do , and
passages.full_quote: Drearily I wound my way downstairs: I knew <used>what I had to do, and</used> I did it mechanically

passages.fragment: to do , and trust he will excuse my not having done it before
passages.full_quote: I am most thankful that the discovery is made in time for me to pay my respects to him, which I am now going <used>to do, and trust he will excuse my not having done it before</used>
